AboutBusiness.title: Why Your Business Needs More Than Just a Website‚ÄîIt Needs a Sales-Generating Machine
AboutBusiness.introParagraph1: In today‚Äôs digital world, your website isn‚Äôt just an online brochure‚Äîit‚Äôs your business‚Äôs most powerful sales tool. Yet, too many business owners settle for generic, do-it-yourself website builders that leave them frustrated and stuck with a site that looks nice but doesn‚Äôt actually bring in customers.
AboutBusiness.introParagraph2: If your website isn‚Äôt attracting visitors, building trust, and converting sales, it‚Äôs not just a bad website‚Äîit‚Äôs costing you money every single day.
AboutBusiness.harshRealityTitle: The Harsh Reality: A Bad Website is Worse Than No Website
AboutBusiness.harshRealityText: Think about the last time you searched for a business online. Did you land on a website that looked outdated, took forever to load, or made it hard to find what you needed? You left. That‚Äôs exactly what happens when potential customers encounter a poorly designed website.
AboutBusiness.harshRealityListItem1: ‚ùå Makes you look unprofessional ‚Äì First impressions matter.
AboutBusiness.harshRealityListItem2: ‚ùå Loses customers to competitors ‚Äì A slow or confusing site drives customers away.
AboutBusiness.harshRealityListItem3: ‚ùå Wastes your time & money ‚Äì DIY builders often leave you with a site that doesn‚Äôt work properly.
AboutBusiness.harshRealityListItem4: ‚ùå Doesn‚Äôt show up on Google ‚Äì Poor SEO means potential customers can‚Äôt find you.
AboutBusiness.harshRealityListItem5: ‚ùå Fails to convert visitors into paying customers ‚Äì Your site should generate leads and sales.
AboutBusiness.benefitsTitle: What a High-Performing Website Can Do for Your Business
AboutBusiness.benefitsIntro: A high-performing website should be your hardest-working employee, working 24/7 to attract, convert, and retain customers.
AboutBusiness.benefitListItem1: ‚úÖ Build trust & credibility ‚Äì A sleek, modern site boosts your professional image.
AboutBusiness.benefitListItem2: ‚úÖ Attract more customers ‚Äì Expert SEO drives consistent traffic.
AboutBusiness.benefitListItem3: ‚úÖ Convert visitors into customers ‚Äì Clear, persuasive design guides actions.
AboutBusiness.benefitListItem4: ‚úÖ Work on all devices ‚Äì A mobile-friendly site reaches a wider audience.
AboutBusiness.benefitListItem5: ‚úÖ Scale with your business ‚Äì Custom solutions grow with your needs.
AboutBusiness.packageTitle: What‚Äôs Included in Your Custom Website Package?
AboutBusiness.finalCallTitle: Ready to Take Your Business to the Next Level?
AboutBusiness.finalCallText: A bad website is costing you sales every single day. Don't let another customer slip away. Invest in a high-converting website today and watch your business soar.

Contact.title: Contact Us(NOT IN USE)
Contact.subtitle: We're here to help. Reach out to us through any of these channels or send us a message directly.
Contact.question: Question
Contact.question1Title: How quickly do you respond to support requests?
Contact.question1Answer: We typically respond to all support requests within 1 business day during our support hours.
Contact.question2Title: Can I visit your office without an appointment?
Contact.question2Answer: Our support office is available for walk-in visits during regular business hours. For specialized assistance, we recommend scheduling an appointment.
Contact.question3Title: Do you provide support in multiple languages?
Contact.question3Answer: Yes, our support team is fluent in English, Finnish, Swedish, and Russian.
Contact.question4Title: What information should I include in my support request?
Contact.question4Answer: Please include your contact information, flight details (if applicable), and a detailed description of your inquiry or issue.

AssociationRules.title: Rules of the Nummela Airfield Association

section1.title: ¬ß 1 Name and Domicile
section1.content: The name of the association is Nummela Airfield Association and its domicile is the municipality of Vihti.

section2.title: ¬ß 2 Purpose and Nature of Activities
section2.p1: The purpose of the association's activities is to promote aviation, aviation training, sports activities, and youth work in Vihti. To fulfill its purpose, the association operates in Nummela and maintains the Nummela airfield.
section2.p2: In its activities, the association maintains and promotes, in a fair and equitable manner, the operational prerequisites and flight safety for general aviation, recreational aviation, and commercial aviation at Nummela airfield.
section2.p3: To secure the association's activities, the association makes initiatives and proposals to various authorities, monitors and comments on regulatory changes affecting its operations, agrees on airspace use with the controlling authority, and cooperates with other communities operating at the airfield.
section2.p4: To support its activities, the association collects membership and usage fees from its members and airfield users, and acquires funds from public and private grants. The association may carry out all publishing, revenue-generating, and fundraising activities to fulfill its statutory purpose, applying for necessary permits. The association may accept donations and bequests. The association may own and manage real and movable property. The association's activities are not profit-seeking, nor is its aim to gain immediate financial benefit for participants.

section3.title: ¬ß 3 Members
section3.content: A legally competent entity that accepts the association's purpose and commits to complying with the association's rules and guidelines prepared by the board may be accepted as a regular member.

section4.title: ¬ß 4 Membership Termination and Expulsion
section4.p1: A member has the right to resign from the association by notifying the board in writing.
section4.p2: The board may expel a member if the member has failed to fulfill the obligations they committed to upon joining the association, or if by their conduct within or outside the association they have significantly harmed the association, or if the specified membership fee has not been paid.

section5.title: ¬ß 5 Membership and Joining Fees
section5.content: The amounts of the joining fee and annual membership fee for regular members and supporting members shall be decided separately for each member group by the autumn meeting. The fee may vary for supporting members that are entities.

section6.title: ¬ß 6 Nummela Airfield Operations Manual
section6.content: To ensure the safety, environmental friendliness, and fair and equitable operational conditions for all airfield users, an operations manual shall be prepared. The operations manual is maintained by the airfield manager, and its changes are approved by the association's board by majority decision. Activities at Nummela Airfield shall follow the operations manual. The operations manual contains guidelines for safe flight operations and other aviation and ground operations within the Nummela Airfield area.

section7.title: ¬ß 7 Board
section7.p1: The association's affairs are managed by a board. The board consists of a chairperson and at least four (4) and at most eight (8) regular members elected at the autumn meeting for two (2) calendar years at a time. Board members serve for two years, with half of the board members retiring annually.
section7.p2: In the first members' meeting after the approval of these rule changes, half of the elected board members shall retire after 1 year, determined by lot.
section7.p3: The board selects from among its members a vice-chairperson. Additionally, the board selects an airfield manager, secretary, treasurer, and other necessary officials. The board may establish working groups as needed and may invite experts to handle and prepare matters affecting the achievement of the association's operational objectives.
section7.p4: The board convenes when called by the chairperson or, if they are prevented, by the vice-chairperson, when they deem it necessary or when at least half of the board members request it.
section7.p5: The board has a quorum when at least half of its members, including the chairperson or vice-chairperson, are present. If neither the chairperson nor vice-chairperson is present at the meeting, one of the board members shall be selected to chair the meeting. Decisions are made by absolute majority. In case of a tie, the chairperson's vote decides.
section7.p6: Board meetings may be attended by telephone or other technical means when the person is identified. Board meetings may also be held remotely. The board prepares the Nummela Airfield Operations Manual together with the selected airfield manager and maintains it. The board decides on airfield usage fees.

section8.title: ¬ß 8 Signing for the Association
section8.content: The association's name may be signed by the chairperson, vice-chairperson, and treasurer each alone, or by two board members together.

section9.title: ¬ß 9 Fiscal Year
section9.content: The association's fiscal year is the calendar year.

section10.title: ¬ß 10 Association Meetings
section10.p1: The association holds two regular meetings annually. The association's spring meeting is held in March-May and the autumn meeting in September-December on a date determined by the board. The time and place of the meeting are decided by the board.
section10.p2: An extraordinary meeting of the association shall be held when so decided by an association meeting, or when the association's board deems it necessary, or when at least one-tenth (1/10) of the association's voting members request it in writing for handling a specific matter. The board must arrange the meeting within thirty (30) days of receiving the written notice.
section10.p3: At association meetings, each regular member has one vote. Meeting representatives must present a power of attorney from their member community. The decision of the association meeting is the proposal that receives more than half of the votes cast. In case of a tie, the chairperson's vote decides; in elections, however, the lot decides.
section10.p4: Supporting members have the right to attend association meetings but do not have voting rights at association meetings. Participation in association meetings may also be by telecommunications, telephone, or other technical means during or before the meeting when the person is identified, if so decided by the board or the association meeting. Association meetings may also be held remotely.

section11.title: ¬ß 11 Convening Association Meetings
section11.p1: The board must convene association meetings at least seven days before the meeting.
section11.p2: The meeting notice is sent to the association member at the email address they have provided to the association. If a member does not have an email address, the notice is delivered by mail.

section12.title: ¬ß 12 Regular Meetings

springMeeting.title: Spring Meeting
springMeeting.item2: Election of meeting chairperson, secretary, two minutes reviewers, and two vote counters
springMeeting.item3: Confirmation of the legality and quorum of the meeting and participants
springMeeting.item5: Presentation of financial statements, annual report, and audit report
springMeeting.item6: Decision on approval of financial statements and granting discharge from liability to the board and other liable persons
springMeeting.item7: Handling of other matters mentioned in the meeting notice

autumnMeeting.title: Autumn Meeting
autumnMeeting.item2: Election of meeting chairperson, secretary, two minutes reviewers, and two vote counters
autumnMeeting.item3: Confirmation of the legality and quorum of the meeting and participants
autumnMeeting.item5: Approval of operational plan, income and expenditure budget, and amounts of joining and membership fees for the next fiscal year
autumnMeeting.item6: Election of the board chairperson for the next two calendar years
autumnMeeting.item7: Election of other board members (4-8) as provided in the rules
autumnMeeting.item8: Election of auditor and deputy auditor or audit firm for the fiscal year
autumnMeeting.item9: Decision on remuneration for board members, auditors, etc.

section12.footer: If an association member wishes to have a matter handled at the spring or autumn meeting, they must notify the board in writing 30 days before the meeting.

section13.title: ¬ß 13 Amendment of Rules and Dissolution of Association
section13.p1: The association's rules are amended by a decision of the association meeting by majority vote.
section13.p2: A decision to dissolve the association must be made at an association meeting by a majority of at least three-quarters (3/4) of the votes cast.
section13.p3: The meeting notice must mention the amendment of rules or dissolution of the association.
section13.p4: Upon dissolution of the association, the association's assets shall primarily be used for the benefit of Nummela Airfield and secondarily for promoting general aviation and sports aviation, in the manner decided by the meeting deciding on the dissolution. If the association is dissolved, its assets shall be used for the same purpose.
